IS LEANING NOW, ACROSS PARK AVENUE, ONTO THE SKYSCRAPER O
AND _THE CAMERA SLIDES DOWN, FOUR FEET OR SO, COMING TO A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE ON THE CITY -- we're looking DOWN ON MANHATTAN as th MORNING SUN breaks through the skyline. And as the image adjusts slightly, we realize we’re looki THROUGH A VIDEO CAMERA. We hear a MAN’S VOICE. It’s whispered, quiet --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Six forty-two a.m... Hig name _is ROB HAWKINS. As he backs away from the window, we catch a glimpse of H REFLECTION in the glass. And even though the VIDEOCAMERA obscuring most of his face, we can tell he’s smilina --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: It’s already a good day. And as Rob SWINGS THE CAMERA AROUND we get a better look our surroundings -- we're in a MANHATTAN APARTMENT -- flo to-ceiling windows; opulent but not garish. The tasteful decor suggests a feminine touch. CAMERA MOVES THROUGH the living room. We hear Rob’s BARE FEET quietly padding along the hardwood floors -- He approaches a SIDE TABLE covered with FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH they’re all of A GIRL (Beth) and her various friends and family. Rob's hand reaches into frame, selects one photograph in particular:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 2.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rob and Beth at COLLEGE GRADUATION. They're both wearing and gowns; they’re both smiling for the camera. Rob takes photo, moves it in front of the other photos on the table

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 2
dialogues.text: INT. BETH’S APARTMENT - MORNING - LATER 3 We’re MOVING THROUGH THE APARTMENT, getting a better feel the place. Everything’s still MORNING QUIET -~ the silenc is peaceful, serene. We can hear Rob’s footsteps, his ste breathing, the distinctive sounds of his hands on the cam We turn a corner, headed down a hallway. Rob's hand pushe open a door, leading us into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the apartment’s bedroom. And the BLUB LIGHT of dawn is just starting to peek through the curtains. As Rob enters the room, he angles towards the bed, focusing in on -- Her. She’s in bed, fast asleep. (Tastefully) covered by t sheets. And for a moment, we just HOLD ON HER. This is BETH MCINTYRE. As the morning-light finds her face, we can see she‘s hal smiling in her sleep. She looks near angelic. Rob approaches, angling in on Beth’s face. He sits down o the side of the bed, his movement rousts her a bit. Her eyelids flutter open --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (half-asleep) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing. Beth rubs the sleep out of her eyes, sits up a bit. Glanc at the camera, playful --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Suddenly she’s shy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 3.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Seriously -- I can just see this ending up on the internet... She pulls the bedsheet tight around her, making sure she’ safely covered.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Fine -- see if I care. (beat) I'm interested in other things...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (rolls eyes) Like what?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Like... you. I want to know everything there is to know about Elizabeth Anne McIntyre.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You already know everything, Rob.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: That‘s not true. After last night... we can still surprise each other, She flushes a little, smiles --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Fair enough. (okay then) What would you like to know, Robert Hawkins?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Well, let’s start with... What do you want to do today?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: That’s it? You can ask me anything in the world and you go with "What do you want to do today?”

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sure. For starters. Beth studies him -- fine, 1’11 play along --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Okay then... (thinks about it} I'd like to eat breakfast. No -- I'd like you to bring me breakfast. Here. In bed. I think I’ve earned that...

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Really? ‘Cause I think I'm the one who did all the work... She raises her eyebrows -- are you kidding me? curt TO: INT. BETH’S BEDROOM - MORNING - LATER s A little later. Beth's shifted position a bit. She‘s eati strawberries out of a bowl (clearly Rob lost the breakfas bed argument.) We UPCUT right into their conversation --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- I‘ve never been. -- it‘s not what it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I hear it’s fun.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sure. If you want to score horse,

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: That's not the -- (wait) Did you just call it “horse?”

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (laughing} -- it's not the same Coney Island you’re thinking of --

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- that's not the point --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE SHOT -- ON ROB. He’s shirtless, clad only in paja bottoms. He leans back against the headboard, uncomfortab being filmed --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 5.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: ...from the neck up. That’s it. That‘’s the only way I consent to this.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about it, Rob. Nobody's paying for that online. Rob glances down at his body, mock offended --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: People would kill for this.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay -- what else?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Other than cotton candy and tilt-o- whirls -- what do you want to do today? Rob stares at her with mischievous eyes for a beat. Then

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Beth... if I answered that question honestly, you'd probably slap me.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Try me. He reaches out, playfully grabs her leg. She laughs, push him away, the camera shakes --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Honestly -- the things I’m thinking right now -- I may slap myself...

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (laughs) -- Rob, I swear to god there’s nothing you could say that would possibly -- And just as she says that, the VIDEO IMAGE fills with STA and we ABRUPTLY CUT TO --  6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HONK HONK HONK! The loud CACOPHONY of New York City TRAFF jars us right out of the previous scene -- We're street level now -- as the video camera adjusts, we catch a glimpse of DOWNTOWN MANHATTAN in all its glory. T we swing around and follow -- A GIRL (mid-twenties) as she crosses through traffic on t busy crosswalk. She’s wearing a JAPANESE SILK DRESS, her hair is pulled back with CHOPSTICKS. This is LILY FORD. We hear a GUY'S VOICE call after her --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Is the light on? Lily glances back at the camera. Slightly exasperated --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Watch where you're going --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if this is the on button or the zoom...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Jason --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think it’s on.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: {glares at him) Perfect. Now we can have a nice record of you getting run over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily's at the counter of a corner grocery store. She's talking over her shoulder as the CASHIER bags her food --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: ..-go around and get testimonials from everyone.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- this isn’t a wedding --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 7.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I know this isn’t a wedding -- I said like a wedding. (to cashier) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why do I have to do it -- The CAMERA SWINGS AROUND as the person holding it looks i the lens. We see his face for the first time -- This is JASON HAWKINS -- Lily's boyfriend and Rob’s older brother. As he looks into the camera --

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: -- I don't even know how to work this thing.

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question -- can you see me through the viewfinder?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hang on -- Jason swings the camera back around to FIND LILY in front the counter, trying to collect her groceries --

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Yeah. I can see you.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Good. (beat) Now... can you see me trying to carry all these bags by myself? cuUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking down at Jason's legs. We see in one hand he carrying several grocery bags. As he raises the camera wi the other hand --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: -- he’s your brother. This is important. Stop trying to get out of it --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 10 6/3/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see Lily’s leading him up a flight of stairs. As they spill out onto the landing, walk down a hallway --

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: -- it’s a shit job, Lily.

dialogues.speaker: LILY JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No it’s not. Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (shooting him a look) Jason.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: {turning on a dime) Okay, baby. I‘1i1l do it. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we’re in an APARTMENT, MOVING TOWARDS A GUY hang a LARGE BANNER which reads “GOODBYE ROB!" --

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Hud -- I got a job for you. The guy looks over his shoulder, sees the camera. Tenses This is HUDSON PLATT.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: I’m already supposed to be working on the sign...

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is actually even more important than the sign -- Hud clearly doesn’t like being on camera. As he shuffles awkwardly --

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You‘ve been to a wedding, right?

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: {shakes head) Not since I was a kid. I don’t really get invited to a lot of things like that.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 9.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, well -- you know how at weddings they have people give testimonials to the videocamera?

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: (chinks; then) No.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (you're killing me) i ,» go around the party, and film everyone wishing Rob good luck.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: {deer in headlights} That sounds like a lot of responsibility, Jason. I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s important. We’1ll need you to talk to everyone, Hud. (beat) We'll need you to talk to Marlena. Hud’s eyes dart towards the camera. Wait --

dialogues.speaker: BUD
dialogues.text: Marlena'’s gonna be here?

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Lily invited her. And we need you te talk to her. You know. For Rob. And that's actually giving Hud pause --

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But you should practice first. Here -- put this around your neck like this -- dason takes the camera, loops the strap around Hud’s neck

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 11 12 13 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testimonial. Jason looks into the camera. IN THE APARTMEN BEHIND HIM, we see SEVERAL PEOPLE decorating the place fo PARTY. As they move furniture, set out food, hang lights

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Rob, good luck in Japan, man. I love you. {beat; then) That’s it.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Easy enough, right?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s kind of fun, actually.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (what?} Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COUPLE (JENN and ANTONIO) finish hanging a string of lights. As the lights flicker to life around the room --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Hey guys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testimonial. Jenn and Antonio face the camera --

dialogues.speaker: JEKN
dialogues.text: Bon voyage, Rob! {glances at Antonio) Or, however you say that in Japanese...

dialogues.speaker: ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Sayonara?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 20 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard

dialogues.speaker: JENN
dialogues.text: Sayonara Rob! (frowns) No, that’s not right...

dialogues.speaker: ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Sayonara Rob!

dialogues.speaker: JENN
dialogues.text: That sounds like we want to homb him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll. 20 Testimonial. Lily stands in front of the camera. In the background, we can see the party's in full swing now.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Robert Hawkins. I can’t believe you're leaving me. To take care of Jason. By myself. And this is your fault in the first place -- if you hadn’t introduced me to your brother, I’d probably be married to some handsome stock broker right now instead of -- (glances off camera, raises voice) Madly in love with a buffoon.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m standing right here.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: {back to camera) And I know we’re not officially family -- (looks off screen) Yet.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: ~~ It's gonna be soon, beautiful. I promise ~~

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (back to camera) But I think of you as my brother and I hope you think of me as a sister...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Lily talks, IN THE BACKGROUND behind her, the front do opens, and A WOMAN enters the apartment -- Hud‘s camera drifts off to the side, as he angles towards WOMAN. Cutting-edge stylish, a clear air of superiority about her. This is MARLENA DIAMOND. Lily continues, not noticing Hud’s focus is drifting --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: ...Which means you have to check in with me from time to time. (getting choked up) I know this is an... amazing job for you. And I know this is what you need right now, but... that doesn’t mean I have to like it. Hud‘s starts to ZOOM IN on Marlena. Lily’s barely in fram

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You'd better call us. Now that you have this job, you can afford to call us. So-- {notices} Hud? Hud swings the camera back to Lily.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Yeah -- sorry. You‘re good.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (okay then...} Rob -- call us. We love you and miss you. So much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACROSS THE ROOM, we see Lily greet Marlena. As she hugs h hello --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (to himself) Okay. You can do this...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 22 23 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 13.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts moving through the party. TOWARDS MARLENA. But he approaches her, she glances up, and Hud panics at the minute. He swings the camera TOWARDS A GUY hanging out nearby (CHARLIE. } cuUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testimonial. Charlie faces the camera --

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Rob -- this is very important. When going to a hentai theater, you want “yuri.” Not, repeat, not “yaoi.” (beat) “Yaoi” means “all boys.” Charlie takes a drink from his beer. Then --

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This advice also applies to the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud steels his nerve. Tries again. APPROACHES MARLENA.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh -- uh. Excuse me, um... Marlena? She turns, surprised to hear her name. Stares at Hud, a b of a “Why are you talking to me?" leok on her face.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: (voice wavering) I’m supposed to be... uh... (beat) You know how Rob’s going away, right? Well, I’m supposed to be talking to everyone...

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Oh -- I don’t know Rob all that well. I just stopped by to see Lily, be polite.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 14.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s cool. {beat} But, um, I'm still supposed to talk to everyone and it’s like... {awkward pause; then) Have you ever been to a wedding?

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: (frowns) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testimonial. Marlena faces the camera --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Rob -- let’s be honest here. We’ve met like three times before, and all three of those times I was either tanked or tranqued. Or both. So I hope you understand if I don’t get all weepy at your goodbye. (beat) But... it sounds like this is a great opportunity for you. Vice President of something or other, right? That‘s spectacular. (beat) Den't worry, we'll try to keep New York safe for you while you’re gone. cuUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Marlena glances back at Hud, a thought occurring to her --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Do you have a card? My agency’s having a retreat next week -- I’m sure they'd love something like this.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, um, I’m not a professional... (off her look) I’m actually Rob and Lily‘’s friend. Hud. We’ve met several times before.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 26 27 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 1s.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: (doesn’t know him) Oh right. Of course. Sorry, you had the camera blocking your... face.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. That makes sense. No problem. She gives him a polite, dismissive smile, turns to get aw from him, As she goes --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: If you want, though, I’11 still film your agency‘s... But she’s not listening anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.5S.)
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: INT, APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Lily shuts off the lights, races through the crowd --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: -- quiet -- everybody, quiet -- he's coming -- People gather around the living room. A hush falls as everyone quiets down, waits. Hud focuses on the FRONT DOO CLICK. It swings open. One of ROB’S FRIENDS (DAVIS) steps inte the apartment, mouths to the crowd “He's right behin me.” The crowd takes a breath in anticipation, then -- Rob steps through the doorway. They flip the LIGHTS ON --

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Rob jumps, legitimately surprised. Then he takes a breath figures out what’s going on. He hangs his head -- oh, hel He shakes his head, moves to turn around and go back outs The crowd laughs. And Rob steps back into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's hugging Rob, patting him on the back --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 16.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: When did you guys plan all this? As he glances around the party, we get the sense he's loo for someone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit later. Everyone's quiet; Rob stands in front of the crowd, a bit uncomfortable with all eyes on him. But he tries to put the best face on it as he addresses the part

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Wow. This is... this is a surprise. Obviously. And... it’s very sweet. {locks around) Thank you Lily -- Lily calls out from the back of the crowd --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It was everyone, it was everyone --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Thank you everyone. This really... this really means a lot. (then) That's it. That’s all I got. He raises his glass in toast --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Let’s have some fun. Everyone CHEERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PICK UP ROB as he approaches Hud --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hey Hud... is, uh... (looks around) Is Beth coming tonight?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. I mean, I'm sure Lily invited her. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 17.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED HUD, (CONTINUED)
dialogues.text: (beat) Why wouldn’t she be here? And Rob doesn’t answer. He just shakes his head. No reaso -After a beat, he glances at the camera, frowns --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: What are you doing, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh -- Ifm in charge of going around, getting testimonials from everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: {laughs) How'd you get stuck with that job? Silence. Rob glances at the camera, realizes --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: {turning on a dime) I mean -- that’s a huge, huge --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: {dead serious) This is gonna be your lifeline between there and here.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: I know -- I'm thanking you. I'm already thanking you in advance -- cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the testimonials. TWO GIRLS (HEATHER AND LEI) fac the camera, raise their glasses in toast --

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER LEI
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Rob! Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: As soon as you get settled, you should fly us out there to visit you,

dialogues.speaker: LEI
dialogues.text: (laughs) You are such a whore.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 32 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 18.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I am not -- I didn’t mean it like that --

dialogues.speaker: LEI
dialogues.text: How else could you mean it?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not like -- (looks at camera) Hud, erase that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Jason stand near the table where all the booze is Jagon’s laughing. We UPCUT right into their conversation

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: You swear to god you didn’t know?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- I swear to god. Didn’t see it coming at all. I was completely -- And as Rob glances off-screen, his FACE FALLS. Hud follow his gaze -- ACROSS THE ROOM -- WE FIND -- BETH. She’s stepping into the living room, hugging Lily hello. right by Beth's side... is ANOTHER GUY. He smiles, shakes hands with Lily as Beth introduces him -- Hud SWINGS THE CAMERA BACK to Reb. Who’s just staring at Beth and this guy. After a beat, Jason glances at Rob --

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: What‘s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (tries to shake it off) Nothing. Rob steels himself, steps forward to greet Beth. Jason st behind, glances at Hud --

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Who's that guy?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 33 34 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 19.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob approaches Beth and the guy. As Beth hugs Rob hello -

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: ...I’m s0, so sorry we missed the surprise --

dialogues.speaker: ROB BETH
dialogues.text: -- that’s all right -- -- major cab problems -- I'm really sorry --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Rob glances at the Guy. Beth reads his look --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Sorry -- Rob, this is Travis. Travis, this is Rob.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (shakes his hand} Hi.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: It’s a pleasure. I‘ve heard a lot about you. Rob doesn’t say anything. Just glances at Beth. Travis tries to fill the ensuing silence.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Congratulations, by the way. Vice President. That’s fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thanks. HOLD on the awkward silence. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
