dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rob? CRASH! Just then, the sound of a WINDOW SHATTERING jolts Hud. He swings the camera -- ACROSS THE STREET -- we see SEVERAL PEOPLE kicking in the door of a corner ELECTRONICS STORE. LOOTERS immediately storm the place -- Hud swings the camera back to the group -- Marlena’s glan out at the CHAOS building in the streets. She looks at Hu

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 54.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: We can’t stay here... Chirp. There’s that sound again. Hud swings the camera ba towards Rob --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rob... we gotta get moving. It’s not safe here. We gotta -- (trying to think) I don’t know. We could go up, try the Williamsburg... Or try to cross to the other side... try the Tunnel or something -- I don’t know, I don't know -- (beat) But she’s right -- we can’t stay here -- we gotta do something... Chirp. Hud HOLDS ON ROB. It’s not even clear if Rob’s hearing Hud right now --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What do we do, Rob? AROUND THEM -- we can hear the distant sounds cf people's SCREAMS; the dull thudding of what sounds like EXPLOSIONS Chirp. There it is again. Only this time -- Rob seems to recognize it. In fact, the sound seems to ro him slightly. He glances down, reaches into his pocket -- And pulls out his phone. As he flips it open, realizes --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) There’s a message... Rob hits a button on his phone, trying to playback but th Chirp. Rob tenses as he realizes THAT NOISE he’s been hearing is the sound of his battery dying --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: No -- He tries to dial again, but -- Ch-chirp. The phone DIES OUTRIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We hear his breath catch in his throat -- PANIC building his chest as he tries to hold himself together. His eyes dart up, glances around -- what do I do... what do I do.. And then, suddenly, without warning -- Rob turns and starts walking away.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Rob -- ? It's like he’s ina trance. We can hear Rob mutter to himself as he passes Hud --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: My phone's dead... Hud swings the camera towards Marlena and Lily. Marlena’s looking at Rob in disbelief --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Where are you going? (glances at Hud) What‘s he doing? Hud turns to FOLLOW ROB. But Rob’s moving fast, making a beeline right towards the ELECTRONICS STORE. As Hud hurri to catch up, we see LOOTERS emerging from the store -- Two guys are carrying a FLATSCREEN TELEVISION. Another person is racing out with a STEREO. Rob walks right by th Deesn’t even seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rob, what are you doing? Wait -- As they approach the entrance --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh Rob... this store’s closed. Rob walks right inside, passing looters on the way out. H hesitates for a moment, then follows his friend -- INT. ELECTRONICS STORE - NIGHT AglL -- inside the store. As Rob makes his way down the aisles passing looters.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Rob -- seriously -- They pass SEVERAL TELEVISIONS mounted on the wall --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 56.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: We shouldn't be h-- And Hud stops in his tracks, angles towards the TELEVISIO as he realizes -- There are NEWSCASTS plaving on the screens, ON THE FIRST TELEVISION -- we see FOOTAGE of the BROOKLYN BRIDGE. A news shot shows us a GIANT HOLE torn right thro the center of the structure. But it’s the SECOND TELEVISION that catches Hud’s attention... THE NEWS BANNER reads: “CREATURE ATTACKS NEW YORK.” ON THE SCREEN: a helicopter shot is looking down on the c through the alleys of SKYSCRAPERS. And there, behind one the buildings, is -- THE MONSTER. It's hard to make it out clearly -- it’s dark, we get the sense the helicopters don’t want to get too close. But as their spotlights flare across it, we see enough to know - That's a creature, all right. It’s ABSOLUTELY ENORMOUS -- big as the skyscrapers around it, if not BIGGER. Its mass body scrapes against a nearby building, sending DEBRIS

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Oh jesus... RUMBLE. Hud jerks, surprised, and swings the camera towar the front of the store -- THROUGH THE DOORS -- we can see a convoy of MILITARY HUMV and TROOP TRANSPORTS racing past us down the street -- Hud swings the camera back TOWARDS THE TELEVISIONS. We se LOOTER has stopped whatever he was doing and is now watch the television with HUD -- On the first screen -- we see a FIELD REPORTER standing behind what looks like a MILITARY BLOCKADE -- On the second screen -- the helicopter’s angling around, trying to get a better vantage point of the MONSTER. Hud reaches forward, TURNS THE VOLUME UP on both screens --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard s7.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND SCREEN
dialogues.text: -- confirm only that it emerged from the waters south of Manhattan a little over --

dialogues.speaker: FIELD REPORTER
dialogues.text: -- currently in the process of evacuating the city, hoping to contain the creature to the Baxter/Bayard area -- Hud glances over at the Looter next to him --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: That’s not far -- that’s only like, what, twenty, twenty-five blocks from here... The Looter just glances at him, nods. As the NEWSCASTS continue, Hud turns back towards the front doors. Curiosi getting the best of him, he heads --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- back OUTSIDE. DOWN THE STREET -- we see a CONVOY of military vehicles -- they're rolling slowly towards us, HERDING PEOPLE away from the north part of the city -- A VOICE barks orders over a TRANSPORT’S LOUDSPEAKER --

dialogues.speaker: LOUDSPEAKER
dialogues.text: -- gontinue south -- no citizens will be allowed north of Canal for any reason -- Hud heads towards them, ducks round the corner. Angles th camera DOWN THE STREET -- IN THE DISTANCE -- we can see the same HELICOPTER SEARCHLIGHTS we saw on the NEWSCASTS. We recognize one of the SKYSCRAPERS; we see the same TRAILS OF DEBRIS snaking into the sky. We hear the faint RUMBLINGS of the building shaking -- the noise has almost become commonplace -- Hud ZOOMS IN, we CATCH A GLIMPSE of movement behind the skyscraper. It looks like the GHOSTLY WHITE SILHOUETTE of the creature; one of the SPOTLIGHTS hits it just as -- THE MONSTER'S TAIL whips up above the skyscrapers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: csl 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 5B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hud GASPS. Behind him, we hear the military convoy gettin closer, the LOUDSPEAKER BLARING. Hud turns, hurries round the corner, and back into -- INT. ELECTRONICS STORE - NIGHT col -- the store. DOWN THE AISLES, towards the back of the store, we can see Rob tossing aside boxes of CELL PHONES ACCESSORIES as he searches for the right battery --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Rob -- we don‘t want to be here right now -- But Rob doesn’t even look up -- he’s intense, on a missio As Hud hurries down the aisle towards him -- He passes the TELEVISIONS. And a few more LOOTERS are now watching the screens with RAPT ATTENTION. Hud can’t help himself -- he glances towards the screens -- ON THE FIRST SCREEN -- the helicopter has angled a little closer -- we see THE MONSTER’S BACK -- it’s HUNCHED OVER, seems to be rubbing its body against a building -- We hea COMMENTATOR'S VOICE. He sounds a bit flummoxed --

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: -- at this point, everything is pure speculation -- ON THE SECOND SCREEN -- we see a MILITARY OFFICER trying move the FIELD REPORTER away from the BLOCKADE. She’s try to finish her report --

dialogues.speaker: PIELD REPORTER
dialogues.text: -- will not comment on the course of action, but it’s clear there’s a sizable mobilization of -- Hud angles back towards the FIRST SCREEN. The HELICOPTER SHOT has zoomed in a bit. We can see what looks like FLAK OF SKIN falling off the monster’s back --

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- perhaps some sort of symbiotic relationship with the creature. A parasite, if you will -- The shot ZOOMS IN, following a flake down to the ground. as the flake hits the street... it MOVES.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/B/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 59.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: OH -- whatever it is, it’s moving -- The image is blurry, but we can see PIXELATED MOVEMENT as spider-like parasite skitters across the ground. We see i race towards the MILITARY PERIMETER -- ON THE SECOND SCREEN -- we see the camera SHAKE as GUNFIR rings out -- ON THE FIRST SCREEN -- the parasite LAUNCHES ITSELF at th soldier... WWNSSHHLLK!! The soldier SCREAMS -- though the image is blurry, we get the sense that something VIOLENT HORRIBLE is happening to him --

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Qh my god -- And the first screen ABRUPTLY CUTS to the NEWS STUDIO. Th Anchorman, unprepared, stares back at the camera, stunned

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: (horrified) Uh... ON THE SECOND SCREEN -- we can HEAR the FIELD REPORTER SCREAMING, and then it also CUTS to STANDBY FOOTAGE --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: What are you _avys doing? Hud swings the camera to FIND MARLENA as she pulls Lily through the front doors --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here -- like, now. Where's ~- {sees over Hud's shoulder) Rob! They hurry RIGHT PAST HUD. He turns to follow them. In th back of the store, we SEE ROB tearing open a CELL PHONE PACKAGE. He yanks out the battery --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Rob -- we gotta go. The military’s evacuating this whole place -- Rob slams the battery into his phone. Checks the signal - it’s good. He turns, moves towards the back corner. Where it’s quiet. Marlena throws a glance towards Hud --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 60.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Don’t look at me -- I’ve tried --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Rob -- it’s the army -- and that thing's right over -- Rob flashes Marlena a look that stops her in her tracks -

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Quiet. Rob hits a button, holds the phone to his ear. Tries to listen. Looks frustrated -- this isn't working. He holds the phone down, hits a button. Cranks up the volume. We realize -- he’s putting it on SPEAKERPHONE -~- There's a moment of silence -- Rob, Hud, Lily, and Marlen all stare at the phone, waiting in tense anticipation, th BEEP -- the message starts playing -- And BETH’S VOICE fills the air --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (over phone) Rob -- Rob --~ I can’t -- oh god -- I can’t move -~- She sounds PANICKED, HYSTERICAL --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: {over phone) Rob -- it fell -- my apartment -- the whole wall fell on me -- Hud@’s ANGLING IN ON ROB as Beth’s message plays --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (over phone) -- I can’t -- I’m bleeding and I_ can’t _ move -- C-CRACK -- Just then, A VIOLENT SOUND rings out over the phone -- it sounds like concrete tearing in half -- Beth SCREAMS -- we hear her PANICKED BREATHING as she gasps --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (over phone} Oh god -- Rob -- Rob -- ROB --+ And it CUTS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 91 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 61.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We‘re CLOSE ON ROB as the message ends. As we HOLD ON HIM we can see it all play out on his face as he stares at th phone -- the HORROR at what he’s just heard, the building PANIC in his chest, the overwhelming sense of HELPLESSNES Nobedy says a word. Nobody knows what to say. And Rob? He just stares at that phone. We see his jaw clench, we get the sense he’s fighting off tears, his breathing becomes more and more desperate... But then, after a few beats... something changes in Reb. We see him fight it all off -- it’s as though he doesn’t allow himself to panic. Right there, on the spot, he make up his mind. Knows what he has to do. We see it WASH OVER HIM -- Rob sets his jaw, glances up at Hud... As Rob stares at us, we see COLD RESOLVE in his eyes, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOVE. We're FOLLOWING ROB -- he’s moving fast down side street, out of the main flow of traffic. Marlena, Li and Hud are all struggling te keep up with him. We UPCUT right into their conversation --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.5S.)
dialogues.text: -- Rob, seriously, think about this -- Rob’s on his phone, not paying attention to them --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: {into phone) -- Beth -- Beth -- as soon as you get this, call_me --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: -- Beth lives in Midtown --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (into phone} -- as soon as_you get this. Rob hangs up, about to dial again. We see Hud’s arm enter frame as he points to the DEBRIS RIDDEN SKYLINE --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 92 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 62. CONTINUED .

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: -- Midtown is that way. See what else is that way? Horrible is that way.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: This is insane. We can't go near that thing. If you saw what IJ saw... {genuinely terrified) We‘re not going back into the middle of the city. Rob stops in his tracks --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: No. We're not. {off their looks) You guys aren’t coming with me. He points down the street -- we can see the military conv herding crowds out of the city --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Fall in with the crowd. Let the military escort you out of here. They’1l keep you safe. (genuine) I’m sorry. {beat) But I gotta go. And with that, he turns, continues walking. Marlena looks Hud -- seriously -- what the fuck is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Rob’s on the move. Hud’s racing to catch u with him --

dialogues.speaker: HUD MARLENA
dialogues.text: Rob -- c’mon -- Wait a minute --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Rob -- one of us may have to tackle you. And that’ll just be... unpleasant for everyone. Rob stops again. Levels his gaze at them --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 93 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 63.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Guys. Look at me. This is not me crazy. I know what I’m walking into. You can’t talk me out of it. (beat) Turn around. I’m not asking you to --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (quietly) I‘m coming. And that catches everyone off-guard -- Lily hasn't said a word for quite some time. Rob looks at her, eyes softenin

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Lily... She holds Rob’s gaze, her voice quiet but steady --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I’m coming with you. Rob studies her for a beat. Then nods. Turns to keep walking. Marlena throws her arms up -- is everyone insane

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Guys -- you heard the message. Beth sounded... (eff their looks) You_ heard what _I_heard. Even if we make it to her place, there‘s a chance she might already be --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (eyes FLASH) Don’t. An@ the look Rob gives Marlena stops her cold in her trac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Lily are up ahead, moving quickly through a dark alley. Hud and Marlena follow. As Marlena tries to get Hu to listen to reason --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: -- know what I'm talking about. You don’t think this is a good idea. Try it -- you -- look at me and tell me it’s a good idea --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ag4 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 64.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hud. My name’s Hud. And that sets Marlena back on her heels. They stop as she glances at him, embarrassed --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: I... I know what your name is.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. (beat) Then, to answer your question... (beat) No, I don’t think this is a good idea. Yet, despite that, Hud turns, keeps following Rob anyway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hud and the others hurry to keep up with Rob, a middle aged RUSSIAN MAN approaches them. He’s BLEEDING from a wo on his head -- DRIED BLOOD streaks his face -- He seems DAZED, OUT OF IT. He looks at Hud with HAUNTED EYES. Speaks to him IN RUSSIAN --

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (in RUSSIAN) »..the sky fell. And I can’t pull the bodies out of the debris. There’s too many of them -- (pleads) Please help me -- there’s too many of them --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry -- I don’t understand -- Hud looks up ahead -- to where Rob is still rapidly movin away --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Rob -- WAIT --

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (in RUSSIAN) Somebody has to do something...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: g4 95 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 65.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: -- Idon't know what you’re saving -- And the Russian man relents -- it’s as though he realizes this is futile. His eyes GLASS OVER. He stares at Hud.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (in RUSSIAN) Dead. (beat) They’re all dead. And with that, he shakes his head, an@ walks off. Still i his DAZE. For a beat, HUD HOLDS ON HIM -- should I do something -- but then swings the camera around, realizes has to catch up with ROB --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further into the city. Rob and the others crouch in the darkness. And though she doesn’t look happy about it, Marlena‘s still with them. Rob motions for them to wait. Hud angles the camera out

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE CORNER --
dialogues.text: Down the street -- we see a convoy of HUMVEES AND TRANSPO crossing the street. Our group waits until they pass, the hurry across the street, darting into another alleyway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move, we UPCUT into Rob and Hud’s conversation --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...tried calling 911, see if someone else can get there?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Police, fire department?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (nods) Nothing. All I get is that weird beeping sound. I’m guessing they’ve got their hands --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM! As Rob says that -- the top floor of a building end of their alley EXPLODES -- Our people CRY OUT in surprise as fragments of glass and brick RAIN DOWN. They turn, try to race away from the bla down a SIDE ALLEY, but stop when they see -- A MILITARY CONVOY -- TROOP TRANSPORTS and TANKS are movin forward in formation. We see them BEGIN TO FIRE -- Rob stops in his tracks, not knowing where to go -- KA-BO Behind us -- another explosion rings out -- it sounds lik MORTAR SHELLS detonating --

dialogues.speaker: SSSSSSSSHRHHHRRROOOAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRI
dialogues.text: As we hear the monster’s ANGRY ROAR, we realize -- the military is mounting its COUNTERATTACK. And our people ar caught right in the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: He motions for them to dive for cover. We HIT THE GROUND crouching down behind a car as -- MORTAR SHELLS and GUNFIRE seem to RING OUT all around us. we hear our people CRY OUT in terror, Hud angles the came DOWN ONE STREET -- from our limited vantage point on the group, we catch glimpses of GROUND TROOPS advancing. BooM. There it is -- the distinctive sound of the Monster WALKING, We hear the gunfire INTENSIFY; we hear MORTAR BLASTS, SOLDIERS SCREAMING at one another -- BOOM. It’s getting closer. The car we’re hiding behind seems to SHAKE a bit. Hud tries to scream over the CHAOS

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: We can’t stay here -- But the firefight is SO LOUD, it‘s unclear if anyone hear him. BOOM. Hud shifts the camera a bit -- we catch a GLIMPSE of LILY covering her ears, CRYING OUT in TERROR - DOWN THE SECOND STREET -- we see SMOKE and DEBRIS ROLLING PAST. WHOOSH -- FLAME BURSTS lick the sky -- as though SOMETHING BIG just exploded around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 96 97 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 67.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: BOOM. The car in front of us BOUNCES -- the monster’s clo Hud shifts, sees a glimpse of Rob scanning the street beh them -- then angles the camera -- DOWN THE FIRST STREET -- as we see GROUND TROOPS racing forward -- but as they do so -- KRRR-WHAM! -- a CRUSHED TANK comes flying at them -- it’s though the monster just HURLED IT AT THEM -- it CUTS RIGH

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE CROWD, CRUSHING TROOPS --
dialogues.text: Hud jolts -- we hear him CRY OUT in horror -- BOOM. The WHOLE WORLD shakes. The firefight's DEAFENING -- Panicked Hud tries to swing the camera back towards the FIRST STRE realizes -- ROB’S GONE -- Hud turns around -- there's Rob -- he's pulling Lily and Marlena with him -- looking at Hud -- SCREAMING AT HIM -- it’s so loud, Hud can’t hear him -- Hud gets up, HAULS ASS -- Rob’s racing forward, towards - A SUBWAY STATION. As Lily and Marlena disappear down the stairs, Rob turns back towards Hud --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hud -- COME ON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud races forward, the world SHAKING as the WARZONE explo around them -- Reb grabs him, pushes him forward -- as th dive down the stairs, Hud swings the camera around, looki over his shoulder one last time to see -- The air CATCH FIRE above him as an EXPLOSION rolls over t street outside. The blast knocks them down the stairs -- grabs Hud -- pulls him down into the subway station --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud and Rob race forward, spilling out onto a SUBWAY PLATFORM. They fall forward to the ground -- we catch a glimpse of Lily and Marlena next to them on the deck. Hud’s on his hands and knees -- they’re all GASPING FOR A terror in their throats as they struggle to breathe... an breathe... and breathe... cuT TO:  98 99 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. We UPCUT inte their conversation. Rob’s surveying the platform, thinking out loud --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- cross the platform, take the Stairs, try the other side of the street --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- the other side of the street looks like this side of the street --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- maybe make a break for it when there's a lull --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: Rob -- the air gaught_on fire. It's not lulling anytime soon -- Rob glances at Hud, frustrated. Off his look --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I‘m with you, Rob. I am. But... listen to what's going on up there. Lily glances at the ceiling -- we can hear the dull, viol sounds of DESTRUCTION coming from the street above. She looks at Rob, sympathy in her eyes, but concurs --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. ON ROB -- he’s boiling with frustration, j starting to accept they’re trapped there when -- Beepbeepbeep... Rob's phone RINGS. Whip-fast, Rob reaches into his pocket -- thinking it’s Beth -- but as he looks the display, his face goes pale --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 100 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 69.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: What? (then) Rob? Rob doesn't respond. Stares at the phone as it RINGS. Glances up at Hud -- oh god, what do I do? Then, after a beat, Rob steels himself, flips it open --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (listens, then) Mom? (beat) Yeah -- Mom -- I-I‘m okay, but... Mom -- listen to me -- He tries ta figure out how to tell her this. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: We were on the bridge, Mom. We were on the bridge when -- yeah -- His voice wavers as he struggles with the words. All the emotion he’s been repressing starts to POUR OUT --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Mom... Jason’s dead. He was right there when it hit and... He’s dead, Mom. And he can’t keep it together any longer. TEARS start to spill over --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: He’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds later. Rob’s a little further away. Looks like Hud‘s giving him space. But he’s still on the phone --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Dad -- Dad -- the phones keep cutting out and I -- (beat; listens) Yeah -- Dad -- I am -- I -- Rob turns, glances at the others.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 101 102 103 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 70.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Yeah. We're okay. {then} We're getting out of the city now. We're with the army. Don‘t worry. He takes a beat. Considers his words. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Dad -- listen -- I might lose you -- {goodbye} I love you. Yeah -- we're okay -- tell Mom. Tell Mom -~-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. ACROSS THE STATION -- Rob’s now off the phone. By himself. Lily crosses over to him. Grabs him. Hugs him. He goes weak as she holds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Rob and Lily are now sitting against the wall on t other side of the station. We can’t hear what they’re saying. Hud angles the camera -- he's sitting next to Marlena. Somber. As Hud studies Rob across the room -~

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say to him. {beat) I should say something, but I don’t know what to say... After a beat, Marlena glances at Hud. Realizes he’s waiti for a response. But then she just shakes her head. There’ nothing to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Some time has passed. Hud angles the camera toward the ceiling. As the sounds of BOMBING continue to ring ou we see dust and debris continue to shake loose, rain down

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 104 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone‘s quiet. Shell-shocked. We see Rob and Lily sitting across the station. Rob seems to be staring off a the wall {we can’t see at what.) Boom... The bombing gets louder. And LOUDER. BOOM. The station shakes. Marlena cries out involuntarily. Holds he head in her hands. Trying to keep it together. And failin

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: I’m not even supposed to be here...

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to be. {off her look) You had your chance back there in the alley -- you could have left us. Marlena thinks about that. Then answers honestly --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to be alone. Hud HOLDS ON HER for a beat. Then, in the background, we Lily cross frame as she walks over next to Rob. Hud drifts towards them. What the hell are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud’s on his feet, approaching Rob and Lily --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: ~- we could take the “456.” Hud ANGLES THE CAMERA to reveal Rob’s staring at A MAP OF NYC SUBWAY TRANSIT.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah -- the trains aren’t running right now, Rob.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: No -- we could walk. Look -- He taps the location on the map --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/38/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 72.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Beth lives here ~- 53rd and Park. And the 456 exits just a few blocks from there. It’s a straight shot from here...

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: You want us to walk the tunnels? Lily stares at the map. Sees what Rob’s talking about --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It would only take us about thirty minutes...

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: You_want us to walk the tunnels?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: It’s either that or stay here. A beat. We hear the pounding SOUNDS OF DESTRUCTION above. As the group glances at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER BLACK, we hear --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: It has a light on it --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Why does this thing need so many buttons? CLICK -- Hud finds a light on the front of the camera. It throws a beam forward, Rob blinks, shields his eyes with hand. It‘s not much light -- just enough to see about fiv feet forward.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It's better than nothing. (gestures forward) All right, Hudson. Lead the way. Hud swings the camera down the long, dark subway tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 106 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks back at the others. Rob nods.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Does... somebody else want to film for a while? Rob and the others glance at each other, shake their head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re walking slowly through the tunnels. Hud leads the w We UPCUT INTO CONVERSATION --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- yeah, got a hetter look at it on the news when we were in the store. You were too busy, you know, stealing merchandise...

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: What di@ it look like?

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: I don’t know -- like a giant... dinosaur... or insect, but more... monstrous. I mean... it had arms and... legs. J couldn‘t really see its head...

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: But you can confirm it has arms and legs? Wow. Thank god you saw it,

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You describe it then --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: I’m not even trying.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Did the news say what it was?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: No. I mean, I don’t think so. I couldn’t really hear. (off their looks) It was loud -- people were stealing televisions and... you guys were all yelling at me. But... I don’t think they know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 74,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED HUD, (CONTINUED)
dialogues.text: {beat} How could they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit later. We're further down the tumnel --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- the ocean's big, dude. They found a fish a couple years ago in Madagascar that they thought had been dead for centuries.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- so it’s been down there this whole time, and, what, nobody noticed?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S5.)
dialogues.text: Sure. Maybe it erupted from an ocean trench. Or a crevasse. (off their looks) It’s a theory. For all we know -- it’s from another planet and flew here...

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Like Superman?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, just like -- (beat) You know who Superman is?

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Oh my god. You too? We're totally meant for each other. Oh wait -- everyone on the planet knows who Superman is.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No -- I know -~ I’m just -- (beat) A lot of people get confused about his origin and --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 108 109 110 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 75. INT. SUBWAY TUNNELS - NIGHT los Later still. It seems like we’ve been walking for a while Nobody’s saying much as they trek through the dark, creep tunnels. After a while, just to break the silence --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Remember a couple years ago when that guy was lighting homeless people on fire in the subways?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Jesus, Hud --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Maybe not the best conversation for down here.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right. (beat) I just can’t stop thinking how scary it'd be if a flaming homeless guy came out of the dark right now,

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hud -- seriously -- RUMBLE -- as he says that -- a MASSIVE QUAKING SOUND ring out from the tunnels behind them. Everyone stops in their tracks, looks behind them, tense --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: What was that? They wait in silence. When no further sound comes --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Let’s keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: OMITTED 10g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit later. Things are a bit more SOMBER. Rob and Lily walk up ahead. Hud's almost EAVESDROPPING ON THEM --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 76.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: +..Can't stop thinking that the last thing I said to her was “Good luck tonight, Travis.”

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (quietly) They’re just words, Rob. They don‘t matter. {thinks about it) I don’t have any idea what the last thing I said to Jason was...

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: It’s different.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Because Jason knows you love him. Lily holds Rob's gaze, fights off tears. Nods. Reaches ou and takes Rob’s hand. As they continue walking forward, H drifts back just a bit to FIND MARLENA, who's looking at feet, not paying attention to any of this --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: This is disqustina. Hud angles down to reveal Marlena is looking at -- RATS. A few of them are scurrying past us down the tracks

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: {glances at Hud) If I get rabies, you're taking the stomach shots with me. As Hud surveys the rats --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay. It's a date.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: It’s absolutely not a date. cuT TO:  111 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Everyone’s stopped, looking down in disgus as EVEN MORE RATS race past. The rats all seem to be comi from the tunnel behind our people.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look at all of them --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: It’s New York. It’s the subway. This is why we take cabs.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: They're all going the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: It‘s like they're running away...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: From what? Lily looks back down the tunnels behind her. As our group glances at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're NOW JOGGING through the tunnels. Everyone’s TENSE - We can feel PANIC starting to build --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: How much further?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: I don’t know -- let’s hop out at the next platform -- see where we -- CLICK CLICK CLICK CLICK CLICK -- BEHIND THEM -- an unnatu CLICKING SOUND echoes through the tunnels. It stops them COLD. As they look back --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: You guys hear that, right? Hud angles the camera down the tunnel behind them, but th small light makes it impossible to see more than a few fe CLICK CLICK CLICK -- it seems to be getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 1213 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 78.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (realizing) Night vision. Hud -- the camera‘’s got night vision. See what you can see --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How do I do it?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Should be a hutton on the side there -- near the “on” button --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hang on -- A beat as Hud tries to find the switch. We're looking forward, staring into darkness and then -- Click, The camera switches to NIGHT VISION. Instantly, the world becomes BRIGHT GREEN. And that CLICKING SOUND? It’s coming from the PARASITES. There's five of them. They’re on the floor, the walls, ceiling. Less than ten feet away. Just stopped, staring a us. As though they've been stalking us like prey.

dialogues.speaker: OH GOD --
dialogues.text: As the parasites HISS and start to lunge forward, Hud swi the camera around. We catch a glimpse of our people, look panicked and confused --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hud -- we can‘t see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO REGULAR VISION -- the camera light BOUNCES as Hud races at a dead sprint down the tunnels. He’s pushing the group forward -- they’re all running as_ fast as they can

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 72.

dialogues.speaker: GO GO GO --
dialogues.text: CLICK CLICK CLICK CLICK -- it’s all around us now -- UP AHEAD, Lily glances back over her shoulder -- her EYES WIDE -- she SCREAMS as -- A parasite LAUNCHES ITSELF AT HER -- WHAM -- it hits her the shoulder, knocking her to the ground --

dialogues.speaker: LILY --
dialogues.text: The camera SHAKES as Hud races towards Lily -- we get a better look at THE PARASITE -- it’s roughly the size of a large dog, with multiple flailing legs and a mouth full o razor teeth -- Lily SCREAMS in horror as it lunges at her Rob dives into frame, tries to rip the parasite off Lily Hud sturbles, swings the camera around, the light catches MORE PARASITES. Coming right at Hud. WHAM! The lead parasite rears up on its haunches, knocks Hud to the qrou The camera lands next to him, pointed back down the tunne towards the others. We see Rob fighting with the parasite Lily -- Marlena dives towards the ground, lunging for something (we don’t see what) -- As Hud SCREAMS, the camera is suddenly YANKED BACKWARDS, though the parasite’s dragging Hud down the tunnel, AWAY THE OTHERS (the strap around his neck keeps the camera ti to Hud.}

dialogues.speaker: HELP ME
dialogues.text: We hear the PARASITE THRASHING -- Hud CRIES OUT -- but we can’t see exactly what's happening to him as HE’S DRAGGED AWAY. We're on the ground, looking DOWN THE TUNNEL as Lil and the others grow smaller and smaller in frame --

dialogues.speaker: HUD --
dialogues.text: One of the others breaks away from the fight, races towar camera. As she approaches we realize -- It's Marlena.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 80.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: And we realize what she was diving for earlier -- in her hand, she holds a length of METAL PIPE. She charges towar us, swings the pipe with all her might at the parasite on of us -- WHACK -- we hear the parasite SQUEAL IN PAIN -- Hud struggles to roll over -- as he does so -- the parasi strikes back, charging Marlena, knocking her to the groun As Marlena struggles with the parasite on the ground next Hud -- SQUEEEE -- the parasite opens its mouth, and SINKS TEETH into Marlena’s shoulder -- Marlena SCREAMS IN PAIN as BLOOD SPURTS from her shoulder

dialogues.speaker: SPLATTERING THE CAMERA LENS --
dialogues.text: Hud rolls to his feet -- we see his legs has he KICKS THE PARASITE as hard as he can -- it squeals in pain -- Hud drags Marlena to her feet, then rights the camera -- it like a flashlight so that they can see --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Let's go -- The two of them race forward. The camera shakes as they r as fast as they can, the parasites swarming around them - UP AHEAD -- Rob's KICKING A PARASITE mercilessly -- a cra fury in his eyes as he literally CURB STOMPS the thing to death. Lily rolls to her feet, looking behind us in horror as we hear MORE CLICKING SOUNDS coming up behind us. She pulls off the parasite, points us towards --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Door -- GET TO THE DOOR -- Hud angles the camera --~ sees Lily's leading them toward A MAINTENANCE DOOR. Rob gets there first, yanks it open - as we race towards it -- the parasites are SWARMING

dialogues.speaker: C'MON
dialogues.text: Marlena bolts through the door. Hud‘s right behind her -- parasite LAUNCHES ITSELF at them -- WHAM! -- HITS THE WAL right beside the door just as Hud races through --  114 115 116 117 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard ai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! We're glancing back as Rob slams the door shut. WHA A parasite hits the door -- the frame BUCKLES --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Go -- Hud -- go -- CAMERA SHAKES as they race through the dark corridor -- U AHEAD we see an OPEN DOORWAY -- as we race towards it, we Lily on the other side of the door, waving us ahead --

dialogues.speaker: GET IN --
dialogues.text: Rob shoves Hud through the doorway -- Hud pitches forward into the room -- We catch a glimpse of Marlena on the ground. WHAM! We hea Lily shut the door shut behind them -- Hud falls forward, as the camera slams down into the around -- 22SHZZ -- the TAPE FILLS WITH STATIC and we abruptly CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH’S looking at us. Laughing. Pulling off a wisp of cotton candy and putting it in her mouth. The image is so fast and abrupt it’s almost HAUNTING. Then the screen fil with STATIC again and we CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud's STARING RIGHT INTO CAMERA. It’s as though he‘s checking it over, making sure the thing still works. He shakes his head in disbelief. Then he takes his sleeve and CLEANS THE BLOOD off the lens. As he works, we CUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MARLENA -- we’re looking at the BITE WOUND on her back shoulder. Blood seeps from the multiple punctures --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: How does it look?

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: (after a beat) It looks like it hurts. Marlena grits her teeth, nods -- that sounds about right.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 118 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHUMP -- Hud angles the camera ACROSS THE CORRIDOR, where see Rob kicking in the glass of a VENDING MACHINE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Marlena’s pouring BOTTLED WATER on a scrap fabric that looks like its been torn from Hud’s shirt. Sh looks ASHEN --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: -- those things came out of nowhere -- Marlena presses the fabric to her wound. Winces.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: When it took me down... it was like it was trying to drag me away. She glances at him. Smiles despite herself --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Maybe it liked you, Hud. A beat. We can almost hear Hud smile behind the camera...

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe it was trying to make me its Queen. Marlena smiles at that. Then winces again. Fuck, this hurts...

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Thanks, by the way. For coming back to help me. And Marlena glances at him. We get the sense she‘s actual hurt by that when she says --

dialogues.speaker: MARLEKA
dialogues.text: You think I’m the sort of person who wouldn’t?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: No. No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 119 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And as Hud HOLDS ON HER, we realize we may have misjudged this woman. But Hud never did --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm just saying... I’m glad you did what you did. Marlena looks at him, eyes softening. She nods. It’s an intimate moment. Hud just HOLDS ON HER. cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. The four of them huddle around one another. As the tend to their various scratches and scrapes --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- we could lay low here for a bit, hope those things don’t find their way in... The others glance at each other, shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Next option.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: We could keep moving, try to finda different tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: No more tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Then... we take our chances up top. The four of them sit in silence, thinking it over --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: So... just to be clear -- our choices are “die here,” “die in the tunnels,” or “die on the streets.”

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: We don’t even know where we are. Let’s at least go up, look around, (beat) See if there’s anything we recognize. CUT Ta:  120 121 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOVE. At the end of the corridor, we see faint LIG peeking through a set of doors. Rob leads the way, steps through the doors. Marlena and Lily follow, with Hud bringing up the rear -- Hud steps through the doors and finds the others, looking slightly dumbfounded as they glance around at their surroundings. Hud angles the camera around to reveal -- MANNEQUINS, dressed in designer clothes. They‘re eerily silhouetted -- backlit by the KLEIG LIGHTING that streams through floor to ceiling windows across the vast space, w is filled with racks and racks of clothing.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I recognize this. (beat) This is Bloomingdales. Yep, they’re in a DEPARTMENT STORE. The mazes of subway corridors led them right into the middle of Bloomingdales

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group cautiously makes its way through the store. As HUD PULLS BACK, widening out, we see signs of the chao that must have hit here several hours ago -- overturned racks, shopping bags abandoned on the ground, cash regist knocked off the counters. It's creepy, to say the least. The entire store is empty. Not a person to be seen. As Hud follows Rob and Lily, he realizes Marlena is no longer in frame -- Hud turns -- there she is. But she’s just standing there. glazed, pale expression on her face as she stares off --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Marlena? Marlena looks at the camera, seems to focus --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Yeah -- I’m... just a bit dizzy -- (then, clear-headed} I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 85. As she says that, the shadows behind her seem to MOVE --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: I‘m fine. Let’s ga. As she turns,

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: We've got civilians! The voice jolts Hud. He swings SOLDIERS charge towards them -- weapons sweep the frame -- then group as they all stop in their Jesus, what the hell’s going on THREE BEAMS OF LIGHT rake out of the darkness -- the camera up as THREE ARMED the XENON BEAMS on their settle on the faces of our tracks, put up their hands -- here? The LEAD SOLDIER steps forward (and though we'll never sa his name,

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: Are there any more of

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: No... it’s just us... Pryce barks into his comm --

dialogues.speaker: LEAD MARINE
dialogues.text: let’s call him SERGEANT MAJOR PRYCE.) you? I’ve got four civilians here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOVE. The soldiers lead our group through Bloomingdales. Our group's still stunned -- not sure what happening here.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (urgent) Listen ~- we need help. We cut into their conversation -- Our friend -- she’s hurt -- she’s trapped in her building -- it’s just from here -- 53rd and

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: {shakes head) a few blocks Park -- Yeah, that’s not where you want to be right now.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 123 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 86,

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you guys know what it is? Out there -- do you what that thing is? And as Pryce leads them forward, he almost laughs, his vo sounds HAUNTED as he says --

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: If they know, they ain‘t telling me. (beat) But whatever it is... it’s winning. As they approach the front of the store, they notice more soldiers. A lot more. In fact -- An entire infantry battalion has set up an emergency fiel operations station in the store. Field generators powerin LIGHTS and EQUIPMENT. It’s almost... surreal. And as Hud angles around, we realize that they've just passed into a makeshift TRIAGE CENTER. MEDICS tend to injured soldiers. And one thing is instantly clear -- The soldiers have had the shit kicked out of them.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: -- hey, no -- this one needs to be in quarantine -- Hud slows down, angles the camera toward the VOICE to see MEDIC step away from two soldiers wheeling a STRETCHER. A the Medic redirects the soldiers, Hud gets just a GLIMPSE the stretcher -- and what lies atop it -- Whatever we're looking at, it’s gruesome -- bloody meat w one leg and a head attached... Dear God, it’s a person. Looking almost as if... they exploded. We HEAR Hud’s brea catch in his throat --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t look at that. Hud swings the camera back -- hustles to catch up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud’s following the soldiers into the battalion's COMMUNICATION CENTER: a makeshift hub of radio equipment computers. Rob’s still pleading with Pryce, a growing sen of URGENCY in his voice --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Please -- we can't stay here --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 87.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As they approach the comm center, Pryce holds up a hand t Rob -- be quiet. Hud angles forward as an OFFICER finishe briefing his COMMANDING OFFICER ({let’s call him LIEUTENA

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: .-.we got two F-18s coming out of Sulfridge, four more arming up, maybe thirty minutes out. Graff nods -- good -- he turns towards the room --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Listen up, people... Rack it and pack it! I want us phantoms in fifteen -- As the soldiers start hastily packing up their equipment, Graff glances up at Rob and the others --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: The hell did you find them?

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: They were in the tunnels, sir. Graff studies our group, then calls out --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Medical! ACROSS THE STORE -- we see TWO MEDICS hurry towards them. Graff turns to Pryce, issuing orders as he moves --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Look ‘em over, get them ready for transport. We’1ll put them on the evac choppers.

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: No -- wait -- Graff stops in his tracks -- I'm sorry, what? But Rob doesn’t care. He’s amped up, INTENSE --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: our friend -- she's in trouble -- we have to get to her --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 124 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 88.

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: I can’t help you, Son. {to Pryce) Get ‘em on the choppers. Pryce puts his hand on Rob‘s shoulder, tries to move him of Graff's way.

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: c’mon ~- But Rob knocks Pryce‘’s hand aside --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Don't touch me -- WHOA -- the soldiers tense -- you don’t talk back to thes guys. Pryce bristles, shoving Rob back. And as he does so Graff looks towards Hud -- pushes the camera aside --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Turn that goddamn camera off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. FROM A LOW ANGLE -- we’re looking across t store as two men in HAZ-MAT SUITS approach us. From the camera’s angle, we get the sense that Hud is surreptitiou holding the camera down by his side. We can hear Rob stil arguing with Graff. Graff sounds fucking angry --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: -- in the last half hour alone, I’ve lost three companies of men -- As the HAZ-MAT SUITS pase by us, we see that they’re carr something between them -- It’s a PARASITE. But, thankfully, it’s dead. Dripping thi yellow “blood” which smears the HAZ-MAT SUITS.

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- there's nothing we can -- I’m not asking for your do -- help -- Hud angles the camera to follow the men as they cross tow QUARANTINE: an area cordoned off with a TRANSLUCENT PLAST CURTAIN -- like a portable operating theatre. As the men carry the parasite through the plastic curtain --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 89.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- I just need you to get out of my way -- Hud (discreetly) angles the camera back. We catch a glimp of LILY -- she’s tense, uneasy as she watches Rob argue w Graff. The MEDICS quickly check over her wounds --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- I'm not letting you get yourself killed. Do you have any idea what’s out there? As Hud pans towards Rob, we pasS MARLENA -- she’s looking PALE, WOOZY. Hud lingers on her for a second then --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: idon't care what's out there. Listen to me -- Hud angles the camera towards Rob -- and Rob’s absolutely REDLINING, desperate to get out of there --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: She’s dying. (beat; voice breaking) This girl... The girl that I love more than anything else in this world is DYING. And it’s my fault. She should have been with me tonight and I let her go... (beat) And I get it. You have your hands full. Iqet it. But I’m going after her. If you want to stop me, you're gonna have to shoot _me --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hud... ? Hud angles the camera back towards Marlena --

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Hud... I don’t feel so goad. And we hear Hud’s breath catch in his throat as he realiz Blood is dripping from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Marlena --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 30.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: Everyone looks towards them. As soon as the medics see Marlena, they go to DEFCON ONE --

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Bite -- WE GOT. A BITE! And ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE. Marlena starts COUGHING VIOLENTLY, blood starts pouring out her nose as well. The two guys in Haz-Mat suits come CHARGING out of the quarantine area at top speed, racing towards Marlena. The medics looks at Hud, panic in their voices --

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC SECOND MEDIC
dialogues.text: Were you bit? Was_anyone else bit? The guys in Haz-Mat suits reach Marlena, grab her by the shoulders. Start forcibly dragging her back towards the quarantine area. She looks back at Hud, TERROR in her eye

dialogues.speaker: MARLENA
dialogues.text: Hud --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Marlena -- And he’s moving towards her, trying to follow --

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: Stop him -- It’s CHAOS. SOLDIERS GRAB HUD -- as the camera jostles, w catch a glimpse of Rob and Lily, also being restrained. Medics are searching all of them, frantic --

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC LILY
dialogues.text: Were you bit? No -- it’s just her -- And right then, we hear Marlena START TO SCREAM. Camera swings back towards her -- just in time to see her body s CONVULSING -- as the HAZ-MAT guys race her into the quarantine area, she SCREAMS and SCREAMS -- And just as they usher her through the translucent plasti Marlena seems to ERUPT with BLOOD. SPLASH -- the plastic SPLATTERED with massive amounts of BLOOD. Hud’s fighting with the soldiers, trying to get to her --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 125 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 91.

dialogues.speaker: GRAFF
dialogues.text: GET ‘EM OUT OF HERE -- And as the camera shakes, we catch a glimpse of soldiers pulling Rob and Lily away. And as they yank Hud backwards

dialogues.speaker: C'MON --
dialogues.text: We catch a final glimpse of THAT PLASTIC. Covered in bloo As Marlena’s screams continue to RING OUT --

dialogues.speaker: INT, DEPARTMENT STORE
dialogues.text: Further away. The soldiers are forcibly escorting Reb, Li and Hud towards the back of the store. Pryce is in the le seems to be arguing with ANOTHER SOLDIER. We upcut right into their conversation --

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: (giving orders) -- go and help with the evacuation. I_got_ ‘em from here -- in the background, we can still hear Marlena SCREAMING --

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: You sure? And Pryce looks at our group. Rob and Lily look sufficien terrified right now. Pryce LOCKS EYES WITH ROB as he says

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, They ain‘’t gonna be any trouble. {to soldiers) Go. And as the other soldiers break away, we HEAR Marlena’s screams abruptly STOP. Hud swings the camera back towards Pryce, We hear the panic in Hud‘s voice --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why’d she stop? A long beat. Then he asks again, knowing the answer --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Why’d she stop screaming?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 126 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 92.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And we HOLD on PRYCE as he stares at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later. Pryce is ushering them down a CORRIDOR. Reb‘s making a final desperate plea. We UPCUT into it --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- trapped inside and nobody‘s gonna -~

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: Shut _up and listen. Rob stops in his tracks. Pryce levels his gaze at him --

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: Your girl -- her building -- it’s at 53rd and Park?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (nods) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: Those blocks got hit hard. You may get there and find there's nothing left. {off Rob’s look) You want to go out in this? I ain‘t gonna stop you. The Government's initiated the Icarus Protocol. Which means they're willing to let this area go.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: You mean... Midtown?

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: I mean Manhattan. (off their looks) They’re gonna take one last shot at that thing, but if that doesn’t work, they’re leveling the whole goddamn city. So -- (gestures down corridor) Be my guest. We got bigger problems right now. (glances down) Is your watch still working?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 127 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (beat, then he looks down at his watch, confused) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: The airlifts are leaving from $7th and Third. The last chopper’s wheels up at exactly ch-six hundred. (then) If you can make it there, we'll get you out.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: PRYCE
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Good luck. 93. With that, Pryce turns and heads off back the way they ca Rob glances at the Lily and Hud. Tries to absorb what he just heard. Jesus. Rob glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: That’s not much time...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: {after a beat) Then we should get going.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 127 MOVING FAST THROUGH THE STREETS -- it‘s dark, all the pow in the city now completely OUT. Debris clouds the air; papers flutter down into the street. Hud’s following Rob and Lily. Our three are pretty goddamn shell-shocked righ now. We UPCUT into their conversation --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: -- I couldn't see it -- did you see it, Hud? What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: -- I don’t know, I don't know -- her eyes started bleeding -- and then they were screaming she was bitten -- and she wouldn’t stom bleeding -- and then they were dragging her away --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 128 129 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 94.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hud‘'s voice breaks. It sounds like he’s starting to cry

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: They were dragging her away... Lily glances over her shoulder. Sees Hud. Stops with him

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Hud? Rob stops as well. Compassion in his eyes as he glances b at his friend. As Lily moves towards Hud --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: (I'm not okay) I’m okay. {beat} I’m okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MOVE AGAIN. Rob’s in the lead. Our people are silent. Focused. As we round a corner -- Clep clop clop clop -- A HORSE-DRAWN CARRIAGE emerges fro the dark debris in front of us. As the horse races past camera, we notice the carriage is empty. It’s EERIE. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hud keeps moving -- UP AHEAD -- his camera FINDS ROB. Rob's standing in the middle of the intersection, staring forward (we can't see at what.) He looks like he’s in sho

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Rob? Rob what's the matter? Lily’s ahead of Hud -- she reaches Rob, looks down the street, and stops right in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Guys -~ what is it? -- and we catch up to Rob and Lily, and come around, behi them. And now we see it too. A forty-story tall building, half a block down, has been KNOCKED OFF ITS FOUNDATION --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 95.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: That’s -- that’s not her place, right? Tell me that’s not Beth’s apartment. And we come around, onto Rob, whose wide eyes stare at th structure, in true horror -- he wants to run in there, somehow, but is paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rob?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: {utter shock) Yeah. That’s her place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closer to Beth’s building. Circling the foundation. The debris is HEAVY -- the wreckage litters the area, mak it difficult to get close --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t suppose she’s on the ground floor...

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Thirty-ninth,

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: How do we even get inside?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: We’1l try to climb it. Lily stares at the mound of WRECKAGE blocking the buildin entrance. Sees the snakes of TWISTED METAL and CONCRETE. the understatement of the year --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (quietly) I don’t know if I can climb that. Hud surveys the scene. The camera follows the canted building up towards the roof, where it LEANS AGAINST THE OTHER BUILDING. And we can almost hear the lightbulb go o in Hud’s head.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 130 131 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 96.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh... guys? (beat) We could go across. We climb up that building. 5303. Then find a place to transfer over on the roof. He points upward. They look up, see what he’s talking abo They glance at each other. Huh. That might work. Hud realizes they might actually be considering his idea --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: You know what? Never mind. Bad idea. Bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking up at the "5303” NUMBERS -- then we TILT UP see that we are RIGHT BELOW THE CANTED APARTMENT BUILDING looking UP at where it’s leaning against the other struct

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: (muttering) Nobody listens to me. Ever. Now you listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hud, move, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we're MOVING IN to the lobby, following Rob and Lily -- shattered GLASS and debris EVERYWHERE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re walking briskly up the stairwell. Cracks and random drywall debris. Everyone's out of breath --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Did you see the lock on his face when Lily asked him about it? They really don’t know what that thing is. {beat, realizing) Or they‘re in on it. Oh my god -- has the military been doing any nuclear testing off the coast of New York lately? Rob shoots Hud a look. The fuck are you talking about, Hu

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 37.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: I don’t read the papers. Maybe we Made that thing.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Sure. Maybe we did. So what? Does it really matter right now?

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Yes. It matters. It matters because I have to talk about something or I’m gonna shit myself right here in this stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Qkay, but -- we have to talk about that?

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: No, no we can talk about something else. Anything else. Oh hey, here‘s a topic for debate -- did you guys notice that we're about to transfer over into the CROOKED BUILDING OF

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: And Hud yells so loud it stops Rob and Lily in their trac They glance at each other -- Oh shit. Is Hud finally losi it? There‘s a beat of awkward silence, then --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Maybe... the monster's been frozen up in the polar ice caps all this time... Reb looks at her, nods. Plays along, genuine --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Yeah. And... maybe global warming finally freed it.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: (recovering) Oh, that's good. I didn’t even think of that... (as he follows) Maybe this our comeuppance -- cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 132
dialogues.text: 133 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud‘s lagging behind. He reaches the top of the staircase heads down a hall, catching up with Rob and Lily. They're at the end of the hallway, cautiously glancing ou the SHATTERED WINDOWS, where Beth's building can be seen, RIGHT OUTSIDE, leaning towards us, against our building.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Oh god... And Hud aims his camera OUT THE SMASHED WINDOW -- we can plainly see the ROOF of Beth’s apartment, angled horrifically, shattered at impact, and extending out into sky. They could climb down from these windows, onto the roof, and climb UP the roof. Which is exactly what happen

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Okay. I’11l go first.

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: T‘ll... document it.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Careful -- And Rob climbs out of the window, terrified but determine We watch as he lands on the debris on the roof, he turns back, helps Lily do -- Just then a ROAR -- no, not the monster -- we PAN to the where SIX F-18‘s fly in LON FORMATION, CRACKING THE HEAVE as they disappear overhead -- Rob and Lily wince, then look back toward Hud --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hud -- c’mon -- put the camera down --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus... Hud swings the camera around. Looks directly into the len

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: If this is the last thing you see... (beat) That means I died.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 134-135 136 137 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 93.

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hud --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 134-135
dialogues.text: INT. BETH’S BUILDING - 39TH FLOOR CORRIDOR - NIGET 136 FROM BLACK -- CAMERA ADJUSTS to find Lily up ahead, racin down a CANTED HALLWAY. We’re now in Beth’s building -- everything’s at an angle, there’s debris everywhere. Rob’ nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Rob -- The camera jostles as Hud races to catch up -- WHUMP -- w hear a strange thumping sound -- WHUMP --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rob -- wait for_us -- WHUMP -- there it is again. What is that? Hud keeps movin stepping over shattered plaster -- WHUMP -- and rounds th corner to find -- Rob. At the far end of the hallway. Charging forward -- WHUMP -- SLAMMING HIS SHOULDER into an apartment door. An we realize that's what that sound is -- Rob's been trying break down Beth’s door. As Hud KEEPS MOVING TOWARDS HIM -- Rob sets his jaw -- INTENSE and DETERMINED as he charges the door once again CR-CRACK -- The door splinters, Rob charges inside. Hud a Lily are RIGHT BEHIND HIM -- INT. BETH’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 137 -- and we’re FOLLOWING ROB THROUGH the disheveled, angled apartment. It looks like a disaster area --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Beth! Beth! -- and they arrive at the living room -- stuff thrown EVERYWHERE -- cracked walls and cement chunks -- all thin piled against the “low end” of the apartment. And our CAMERA SWEEPS THE ROOM -- and WE SEE, amid the debris: BETH’S LEGS --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 100.

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: Rob -- right there! And they’re all scrambling down to her -~ and they get to -- Rob grabbing all the debris piled upon her, throwing i away -- Lily and Hud helping too -- and now we see her. She's bleeding from her head, in jeans and a sleeveless T shirt -- unconscious -- Blood all around the area -- Lily gasps -- Rob stares --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSER. Hud’s zoomed in -- we can now only see ROB AND BE in frame. Hud angles towards the REBAR -- we can see it clearly protruding from her shoulder, her blood glistenin the metal, pooling beneath her --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Beth -- Beth -- can you hear me? And we’re CLOSE ON ROB as he stares at her, sees she’s no moving. It's as though his worst fears have been realized oh god, she dead. His face goes WHITE; tears WELL UP in h eyes --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Beth -- oh god -- BETH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he cups her face with his hand, she GROANS. Her ey flutter open. She struggles to focus, as though waking fr a dream. After a beat, her eyes fix on Rob, her voice com out as barely a WHISPER --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hey... And we‘re ON ROB as relief washes over him. She’s alive. can’t help himself -- TEARS start to spill over now.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: {still hazy) Are you really here?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm here. And now Beth starts to WELL UP. Tears spilling as she smi and says --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 101. CONTINUED (2) .

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You came back for me.

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Of course I came back for you. (beat; then) I‘m sorry it took me so long. And it’s a real moment. As Rob says that, we get the sens he’s apologizing for everything he’s put her through. And Beth reads it loud and clear --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (through tears) It’s okay. (beat) I‘m glad you made it. And as she says that, she shifts, and the pain in her shoulder suddenly hits her. She GASPS, cries out. Rob snaps out of it -- goes into emergency mode. He stare down at her. ROCK SOLID as he tells her --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: We're gonna get you outta here, all right? (forming a plan) You’re gonna be okay...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 137 Wider. Rob glances at the others. 137

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: We have to move fast -- Lily's looking at the rebar -- her eyes say “There’s no w Rob checks it out -- tries to move the rebar -- but it WO BUDGE. Rob realizes what they need to do --

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. We need to lift her up and ever this --

dialogues.speaker: HUD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rob I don‘t think we can --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Hud. Put the camera down and help i

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (3)
dialogues.text: Hud does as he’s told. He sets the camera onto the floor

dialogues.speaker: PIECE OF DESRIS COVERING BETH.
dialogues.text: We can still see her legs (and Rob, Lily and now HUD), bu the part of her caught in the rebar is OFF-CAMERA. Good thing, too, because what they do next is BRUTAL. They gra Beth by the shoulders and legs -- ROB (CONT’D) -- this is gonna suck, I‘m sorry. {looks to the others} Okay -- lift -- -- and the three of them LIFT BETH UP, OVER THE REBAR -- SCREAMS and SCREAMS in AGONY -- it’s EXCRUCIATING -- but is the only way -- and finally she’s UP and OFF THE REBAR Rob cradles her, sets her down, As she GASPS, tries to ke from passing out, Rob grabs a strewn tablecloth -- RRRIP tears off a strip and begins wrapping her wound -- Hud grabs the camera -- swings it towards Rob and Beth -- Rob pulls the bandage tight, Beth winces in pain, but kee her eyes locked on Rob. It’s as though she truly can’t believe what she‘s seeing. Fresh tears well up, but this time, it’s RELIEF in her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You came back for me...

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: (holding her gaze) of course I did. And it would be a nice moment if not for --

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (oh god) Guys -- Hud SWINGS THE CAMERA towards Lily -- she’s staring out t windows at something -- Hud angles around behind her to reveal this canted building is hovering over Park Avenue and DOWN THE STREET, THIRTY BLOCKS AWAY, MOVING OUT FROM

dialogues.speaker: HE MONSTER.
dialogues.text: BOOM. OH MY GOD. The Monster turns down PARK AVENUE -- we FINALLY SEE IT in ALL ITS GLORY. BOOM. Unfortunately...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 138 139 140 141 142 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 103.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (4)
dialogues.text: He‘s HEADING TOWARDS US, down the STREET CORRIDOR. And ou building? Happens to be right in his FUCKING WAY.

dialogues.speaker: LILY HUD
dialogues.text: Guys... Oh god. We gotta get out of here --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Let’s move!?! And we now have QUICK CUTS as our foursome SCAMPERS UPHIL out of Beth’s Apartment, through the halls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hud swings the camera around -- we’re back in 5303 Park Avenue. It looks like our group has just climbed through window. As they collect themselves, start heading down th hall, Hud angles the camera back out the window -- And down on the street below, we see the MONSTER’S STILL MOVING TOWARD US. But even worse? DISTANT BOMBS GOING OFF BEHIND IT -- approaching F-18's visible behind the creatu

dialogues.speaker: ROB, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: Hud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're racing through the place as BOMB SOUNDS GROW CLOSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our group hurries down the stairs -- during the mayhem, t sounds of the MONSTER and the BOMBS increasing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We spill out onto the streets. DEBRIS and SMOKE now ALL AROUND US. Over the building chaos --

dialogues.speaker: HUD
dialogues.text: How much time? Rob checks his watch. Shakes his head -- don‘t ask.  143 144 145 146 147 6/8/07 CLOVERFIELD by Drew Goddard 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACING THROUGH THE STREETS. The sounds of destruction building... and building... and building... BQOM. The WOR SHAKES -- BOOM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later -- we keep running -- BOOM. Hud risks a glance, swings the camera behind him -- OVER THE ROOFTOPS -- we catch a glimpse of THE MONSTER. I FOCUSED on the FIGHTERS. It lets out a PIERCING SHRIEK -- swings wildly -- CRASH! It knocks a chunk out of a nearby rooftop. SHRIEKS again. Hud’s seen enough. He turns around, keeps running

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we're RACING ACROSS AN INTERSECTION -- FWWWOOSH -- an streaks by overhead. Flying LOW. Our people wince, cover their ears. The DEBRIS is SO THICK it’s difficult to get bearing --

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Third. Right over there --

dialogues.speaker: WHUP WHUP WHUP WHUP
dialogues.text: kicking up ROTOR WASH -- Hud angles the camera -- DOWN THE STREET -- at the intersection -- we see SOLDIERS waiting for TRANSPORT. As the CHOPPER LANDS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now at the leading zone. Rob’s in frantic conversat with the LEAD SOLDIER. They’re yelling at one another ove the rotor wash --

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: -- said_you’d get us out of here --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
